publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1786 Elaine Thomson: Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books—That the Parliament notes the burning of fishing vessel log books at demonstrations in Peterhead and Hopeman on 12 March 2001; notes that the press release advertising these demonstrations was issued by the SNP; condemns the destruction of log books and in particular, the burning of effigies of the Deputy Minister for Rural Development, Rhona Brankin, at those demonstrations, and calls upon Alex Salmond and Margaret Ewing as local MSPs to condemn those actions and to apologise for their party’s role in promoting those demonstrations.
S1M-1786 Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books (lodged on 23 March 2001) Rhoda Grant*
S1M-1786 Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books (lodged on 23 March 2001) Kate MacLean*, Irene Oldfather*, Mike Watson*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S1M-1786 Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books (lodged on 23 March 2001) Dr Elaine Murray*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Scott Barrie*, Trish Godman*
S1M-1786 Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books (lodged on 23 March 2001) Maureen Macmillan*

S1M-1786 Elaine Thomson: Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books—That the Parliament notes the burning of fishing vessel log books at demonstrations in Peterhead and Hopeman on 12 March 2001; notes that the press release advertising these demonstrations was issued by the SNP; condemns the destruction of log books and in particular, the burning of effigies of the Deputy Minister for Rural Development, Rhona Brankin, at those demonstrations, and calls upon Alex Salmond and Margaret Ewing as local MSPs to condemn those actions and to apologise for their party’s role in promoting those demonstrations. Supported by: Rhoda Grant, Kate MacLean, Irene Oldfather, Mike Watson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Dr Elaine Murray, Mr John Home Robertson, Scott Barrie, Trish Godman, Maureen Macmillan
S1M-1786 Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books (lodged on 23 March 2001) Mr Michael McMahon*
S1M-1786 Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books (lodged on 23 March 2001) Dr Sylvia Jackson*

S1M-1786 Elaine Thomson: Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books—That the Parliament notes the burning of fishing vessel log books at demonstrations in Peterhead and Hopeman on 12 March 2001; notes that the press release advertising these demonstrations was issued by the SNP; condemns the destruction of log books and in particular, the burning of effigies of the Deputy Minister for Rural Development, Rhona Brankin, at those demonstrations, and calls upon Alex Salmond and Margaret Ewing as local MSPs to condemn those actions and to apologise for their party’s role in promoting those demonstrations. Supported by: Rhoda Grant, Kate MacLean, Irene Oldfather, Mike Watson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Dr Elaine Murray, Mr John Home Robertson, Scott Barrie, Trish Godman, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Michael McMahon, Dr Sylvia Jackson
S1M-1786 Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books (lodged on 23 March 2001) Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-1786 Elaine Thomson: Burning of Effigies and Fishing Vessel Log Books—That the Parliament notes the burning of fishing vessel log books at demonstrations in Peterhead and Hopeman on 12 March 2001; notes that the press release advertising these demonstrations was issued by the SNP; condemns the destruction of log books and in particular, the burning of effigies of the Deputy Minister for Rural Development, Rhona Brankin, at those demonstrations, and calls upon Alex Salmond and Margaret Ewing as local MSPs to condemn those actions and to apologise for their party’s role in promoting those demonstrations.
